questions.question: Which suffix would you add to "read" to mean "can be read"?
questions.explanation: "Readable" means "can be read", using the suffix "-able".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something has no use, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Useless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without use".

questions.question: Which word means "without colour"?
questions.explanation: "Colourless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without colour".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something has no bottom, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Bottomless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without a bottom".

questions.question: Which suffix would you add to "convert" to mean "can be converted"?
questions.explanation: "Convertible" uses the suffix "-ible" to mean "can be converted".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be stretched, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Stretchable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "can be stretched".

questions.question: Which word means "without limits"?
questions.explanation: "Limitless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without limits".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be seen, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Visible" uses the suffix "-ible" to mean "can be seen".

questions.question: The word "reversible" uses the suffix "-able".
questions.explanation: "Reversible" uses the suffix "-ible", not "-able".

questions.question: Which word means "without thought"?
questions.explanation: "Thoughtless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without thought".

questions.question: Which word is formed correctly?
questions.explanation: "Breakable" is the correct form, using the suffix "-able".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If you can break something, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Breakable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "capable of being broken".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Someone without a job is ________.
questions.explanation: "Jobless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without a job".

questions.question: Which suffix would you add to "access" to mean "can be accessed"?
questions.explanation: "Accessible" uses the suffix "-ible" to mean "can be accessed".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be believed, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Believable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "can be believed".

questions.question: Which word means "without sound"?
questions.explanation: "Soundless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without sound".

questions.question: Which word is formed correctly?
questions.explanation: "Countable" is correct when meaning "able to be counted". "Countless" is correct and means "too many to count".

questions.question: Which word is formed correctly?
questions.explanation: "Resistible" is the correct form, using the suffix "-ible".

questions.question: Which word means "able to be carried"?
questions.explanation: "Portable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "capable of being carried".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be eaten, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Edible" uses the suffix "-ible" to mean "can be eaten".

questions.question: Which word is formed correctly?
questions.explanation: "Forgettable" is the correct spelling, using "-able" and doubling the 't'.

questions.question: The word "endless" means the same as "unending".
questions.explanation: "Endless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without end", which is synonymous with "unending".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Someone without a home is ________.
questions.explanation: "Homeless" uses the suffix "-less" to mean "without a home".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be understood, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Understandable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "can be understood".

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If something can be repeated, it is ________.
questions.explanation: "Repeatable" uses the suffix "-able" to mean "can be repeated".
